errors.description: Failing to indicate the country or jurisdiction of origin for foreign legal materials, when not obvious from context
errors.violation_detail: Country abbreviation required per Table T2

errors.description: Using non-standard or incorrect abbreviations for country names per Bluebook Table T2
errors.violation_detail: Table T2 requires standardized abbreviations like Ger., Fr., UK, Can., etc.

errors.description: Omitting state, province, or other subdivision when necessary for clarity in federal or decentralized jurisdictions
errors.violation_detail: Bluebook 20.1 requires subdivision for jurisdictions like Canada, Switzerland, Germany

errors.description: Using vague jurisdiction indicators that fail to clearly identify the source country/region
errors.violation_detail: Reader must be able to definitively identify jurisdiction of origin

errors.description: Deviating from the specific format and abbreviation conventions provided in Table T2 for a particular country
errors.violation_detail: Each country has unique abbreviation conventions in Table T2

errors.description: Providing jurisdiction information in text rather than in the required parenthetical at end of citation
errors.example_incorrect: The German code provides... C.C. art. 100.
errors.violation_detail: Jurisdiction must appear in final parenthetical, not in surrounding text

errors.description: Using different abbreviations or formats for the same jurisdiction across multiple citations in a document
errors.violation_detail: Maintain consistency throughout document for same jurisdiction

errors.description: Using non-standard abbreviations for provinces, states, or regions as provided in Table T2
errors.violation_detail: Table T2 provides required subdivision abbreviations

errors.description: Citing only an English translation when the original language source should be cited per Bluebook 20.2
errors.example_correct: Loi relative aux sociétés [Act on Societies] (France)
errors.violation_detail: Original language must be cited with English translation in brackets

errors.description: Failing to follow the capitalization rules of the source language when citing foreign language materials
errors.violation_detail: French capitalizes only first word and proper nouns; apply similar rules to other languages

errors.error_type: Missing English Translation of Foreign Title
errors.description: Omitting English translation in brackets when reader might not understand the original language title
errors.example_incorrect: Loi relative aux sociétés par actions (Fr.)
errors.example_correct: Loi relative aux sociétés par actions [Law on Joint Stock Companies] (Fr.)
errors.violation_detail: Bracketed English translation aids reader comprehension

errors.description: Using incorrect punctuation or formatting for English translation, not using brackets or parentheses correctly
errors.violation_detail: Translations in brackets, jurisdiction in parentheses

errors.description: Using improper transliteration system for languages not using Roman alphabet (e.g., Chinese, Arabic, Russian)
errors.violation_detail: Must use Bluebook-approved transliteration (pinyin for Chinese, Hepburn for Japanese, etc.)

errors.description: Providing transliterated text without indicating it is a transliteration of non-Roman script
errors.violation_detail: Reader must understand that original language uses non-Roman alphabet

errors.description: Translating or modifying abbreviations that should remain in their original foreign form per Bluebook 20.2.3
errors.violation_detail: Foreign abbreviations like OJ, BVerfGE should not be translated or altered

errors.error_type: Missing Abbreviation Parenthetical on First Use
errors.description: Failing to provide parenthetical explanation for uncommon foreign abbreviations on first citation
errors.violation_detail: First use of rare abbreviation should include explanation

errors.description: Improperly handling documents officially published in multiple languages per Bluebook 20.2.1
errors.violation_detail: Cite version actually used; if multiple official versions exist, choose one and be clear

errors.description: Citing a translation without properly attributing the translator per Bluebook 20.2.5
errors.example_correct: German Civil Code 123 (Simon L. Goren trans., Fred B. Rothman & Co. 1994)
errors.violation_detail: Translator and publication information required for translated materials

errors.error_type: Missing Translation Parenthetical for Quoted Passage
errors.description: Quoting translated text without parenthetically noting it is translated per Bluebook 20.2.5
errors.example_correct: "The law provides..." C.C. art. 100 (Fr.) (trans. Simon L. Goren)
errors.violation_detail: Quoted translations require translator attribution

errors.description: Inconsistently mixing original language and English versions of the same material throughout document
errors.example_incorrect: First cite: Loi (Fr.), Later cite: French Law
errors.violation_detail: Maintain consistent approach to language across all citations of same source

errors.description: Providing unnecessary translations for widely understood legal Latin terms or technical terminology
errors.example_incorrect: C. civ. [Civil Code of France] art. 1234 [article]
errors.violation_detail: Translate only when comprehension aid is genuinely needed for target audience

errors.error_type: Incorrect Parenthetical Structure for Language Notes
errors.description: Placing language notation in wrong parenthetical level (should be final parenthetical with jurisdiction)
errors.violation_detail: Language designation belongs in jurisdiction parenthetical, not as separate parenthetical

errors.description: Incorrectly italicizing (or failing to italicize) foreign case names or titles per language conventions
errors.violation_detail: Case names and titles should be italicized as in English per rule 20.2.2

errors.description: Failing to indicate language when source is not in English and not obvious from context
errors.violation_detail: Language or jurisdiction must be clear to English-language readers

errors.description: Using improper format for foreign case names, not following country-specific conventions
errors.violation_detail: Foreign case citations must follow Table T2 format for that country

errors.description: Omitting the official or standard case reporter reference for foreign jurisdictions
errors.violation_detail: Reporter volume, page, and year information required

errors.error_type: Confused Common Law vs. Civil Law Case Citations
errors.description: Using common law citation format for civil law cases or vice versa, not following appropriate jurisdiction type format
errors.violation_detail: Civil law cases typically use case number/date format, not reporter names like common law

errors.description: Failing to identify the court that decided the case when not obvious from context
errors.violation_detail: Court identification essential for reader to assess authority level

errors.description: Placing decision date in incorrect position in foreign case citations, not following Table T2
errors.violation_detail: Date placement varies by jurisdiction; consult Table T2

errors.description: Omitting the docket or case number for civil law jurisdictions where it's standard identification
errors.violation_detail: Civil law citations require case number in format shown in Table T2

errors.description: Using different formats or abbreviations for party names in case citations throughout document
errors.example_incorrect: R. v. Smith (first cite); R versus Smith (later cite)
errors.violation_detail: Maintain consistent case name formatting across all references

errors.description: Providing reporter name in full rather than using standard abbreviation per Table T2
errors.example_incorrect: Smith v. Johnson, [2001] Supreme Court Reporter 42
errors.violation_detail: Reporter abbreviations required per country-specific Table T2 entries

errors.description: Providing parallel citations to multiple reporters but not doing so consistently for similar cases
errors.example_incorrect: Case A: 111 BVerfGE 307; Case B: German Constitutional Court 25 Reporter 50
errors.example_correct: Case A: 111 BVerfGE 307; Case B: 25 BVerfGE 50
errors.violation_detail: Apply consistent parallel citation approach throughout document

errors.description: Omitting page number or paragraph reference when citing specific portion of foreign case
errors.violation_detail: Pinpoint citations required for accuracy in locating specific language

errors.description: Using incorrect symbol or format for paragraph citations in foreign cases (e.g., wrong use of ¶ or §)
errors.violation_detail: Use ¶ symbol for paragraph citations consistently

errors.description: Citing multiple reporters for same case without explaining which is official/preferred
errors.example_incorrect: Case Name, [2001] 111 BVerfGE 307 & German Law Reporter 42
errors.violation_detail: Use primary reporter per Table T2; parallel citations should be clearly identified as such

errors.description: Omitting year of adoption or amendment for foreign constitution when multiple versions exist
errors.violation_detail: Year necessary to distinguish between multiple constitutions per Bluebook 20.4

errors.description: Using improper format for foreign constitutional citations per Table T2
errors.violation_detail: Follow Table T2 for official constitutional name abbreviations and format

errors.description: Failing to cite specific article, section, or provision of foreign statute or constitution
errors.violation_detail: Specific provision required for complete citation per Bluebook 20.4 and 20.5

errors.description: Improperly formatting promulgation or enactment date for foreign statutes
errors.violation_detail: Date format should follow both Bluebook conventions and country Table T2 format

errors.description: Omitting official gazette or publication reference for civil law statute citations
errors.example_correct: Gesetz über die... Oct. 1, 2020, BGBL I at 123 (Ger.)
errors.violation_detail: Civil law citations typically require official gazette reference per Bluebook 20.5.2

errors.description: Using inconsistent format for statutes in common law foreign jurisdictions
errors.violation_detail: Common law foreign jurisdictions need both subdivision and country abbreviations

errors.description: Failing to abbreviate code names (Civil Code, Penal Code, etc.) per country convention
errors.violation_detail: Standard abbreviations per Table T2 required for codes

errors.description: Presenting statute/law numbers in non-standard format for that jurisdiction
errors.violation_detail: Follow Table T2 statute number format for each country

errors.description: Omitting effective date when it differs significantly from enactment date
errors.violation_detail: Include effective date in parenthetical if significantly different from enactment

errors.description: Providing incomplete or unclear English translation of foreign statute title
errors.violation_detail: Translation should be substantive enough to clarify statute purpose

errors.description: Omitting article, section, chapter, or subsection identifier type for statute subdivisions
errors.violation_detail: Specify whether subdivision is article, section, chapter, etc.

errors.error_type: Incorrect Session Law vs. Compiled Code Citation
errors.description: Citing session law format when compiled code is preferred, or vice versa, per country convention
errors.example_incorrect: Statute No. 100 of 2006, BGBL I at 123 (Ger.)
errors.violation_detail: Use official or compilation citation preferred per Table T2

errors.description: Using non-standard abbreviations for foreign periodicals per Table T13 or country-specific conventions
errors.violation_detail: Use Table T13 abbreviations for international periodicals

errors.description: Omitting English translation of foreign periodical title in first citation
errors.example_correct: 20 Revue Internationale de Droit Comparé 25 (1988) (International Review of Comparative Law)
errors.violation_detail: Translation helps readers identify periodical content and purpose

errors.description: Varying between full title, abbreviation, and partial title for same foreign periodical
errors.example_incorrect: First: Revue int'l; Later: Revue Internationale de Droit Comparé
errors.violation_detail: Maintain consistent citation format for same periodical throughout

errors.description: Failing to identify jurisdiction or language of periodical when not obvious
errors.violation_detail: Reader must know source language/jurisdiction when not evident from title

errors.error_type: Incorrect Short Citation Form for Foreign Source
errors.description: Using improper id. or supra format for foreign legal materials
errors.violation_detail: Short cites must maintain jurisdiction and other essential identifiers

errors.description: Establishing hereinafter abbreviation for foreign source but not using it in subsequent citations
errors.example_incorrect: C. civ. (Fr.) [hereinafter C.C.], later citing "French Civil Code"
errors.example_correct: C. civ. (Fr.) [hereinafter C.C.], later citing "C.C. art. 1234"
errors.violation_detail: Once hereinafter abbreviation is established, use it consistently

errors.error_type: id. Used Incorrectly with Foreign Materials
errors.description: Using id. when immediately preceding citation is to different source or has intervening material
errors.example_incorrect: See C. civ. art. 100 (Fr.). Other authority. Id.
errors.example_correct: See C. civ. art. 100 (Fr.). Other authority. C. civ. art. 200 (Fr.)
errors.violation_detail: id. only permissible if immediately preceding citation is to same source

errors.description: Omitting country abbreviation in short citations to foreign materials when ambiguity could result
errors.violation_detail: Jurisdiction required in short cites to avoid confusion, especially if multiple foreign jurisdictions cited

errors.description: Failing to provide official or commonly recognized treaty name in citation
errors.example_correct: Charter of the United Nations, June 26, 1945, 59 Stat. 1031
errors.violation_detail: Treaty name essential for identification per Bluebook 21.4.1

errors.description: Citing treaty to non-preferred source when official U.S. or standard international source available
errors.violation_detail: Use U.S.T., T.I.A.S., U.N.T.S., or regional series per Bluebook 21.4.5

errors.error_type: Missing Treaty Effective Date or Date Signed
errors.description: Omitting date treaty was signed or came into force
errors.example_incorrect: Charter of the United Nations, 59 Stat. 1031
errors.example_correct: Charter of the United Nations, June 26, 1945, 59 Stat. 1031
errors.violation_detail: Date of signing required per Bluebook 21.4.4

errors.description: Failing to cite specific article or section when quoting or referring to particular treaty provision
errors.example_incorrect: Charter of the United Nations, June 26, 1945, 59 Stat. 1031
errors.example_correct: Charter of the United Nations art. 2, June 26, 1945, 59 Stat. 1031
errors.violation_detail: Pinpoint citation to article, section, or paragraph required per Bluebook 21.4.3

errors.description: Using wrong designation for treaty subdivisions (e.g., section vs. article, para vs. paragraph)
errors.violation_detail: Use terminology from treaty itself; commonly 'art.' for articles, 'para.' for paragraphs

errors.description: Failing to provide multiple reporter citations when appropriate per Bluebook 21.4.5
errors.example_correct: Marrakesh Agreement art. IX, Apr. 15, 1994, 1867 U.N.T.S. 154
errors.violation_detail: Parallel citations to multiple sources recommended when available

errors.description: Using non-standard abbreviations for treaty reporters (U.S.T., T.I.A.S., U.N.T.S., etc.)
errors.violation_detail: Use standard abbreviations per Table T4 for treaty reporters

errors.description: Omitting party identification for bilateral treaties without formal names
errors.example_correct: Agreement between United States and China concerning Trade, Nov. 5, 2010
errors.violation_detail: Bilateral agreements without titles need party identification per Bluebook 21.4.1

errors.error_type: Incorrect Format for Treaty Not Yet in Force
errors.description: Failing to indicate that treaty citation is not yet in force or not properly formatted for draft status
errors.example_correct: Treaty on XYZ, June 1, 2020, 1500 U.N.T.S. 200 (not yet in force)
errors.violation_detail: Note status of treaties not in force or in draft stage

errors.description: Failing to indicate that cited treaty has been amended or that a protocol applies
errors.example_incorrect: Charter of the United Nations, June 26, 1945, 59 Stat. 1031
errors.example_correct: Charter of the United Nations, June 26, 1945, 59 Stat. 1031, as amended by [Protocol date]
errors.violation_detail: Indicate amendments or protocols when citing amended text

errors.description: Using different names or abbreviations for same treaty throughout document
errors.example_incorrect: First: Convention on Trade in Endangered Species; Later: CITES
errors.example_correct: Convention on Trade in Endangered Species, Mar. 3, 1973, [citation]
errors.violation_detail: Maintain consistent formal name; establish abbreviation if used frequently

errors.description: Failing to cite to regional treaty series (e.g., E.T.S., C.E.T.S.) when appropriate
errors.example_incorrect: European Convention on Human Rights, Nov. 4, 1950
errors.example_correct: European Convention on Human Rights, Nov. 4, 1950, Europ. T.S. No. 5
errors.violation_detail: Regional treaties should cite regional treaty series when available

errors.description: Failing to provide necessary parenthetical information about treaty (e.g., number of parties, current status)
errors.example_correct: Treaty on XYZ, June 15, 2012, 1234 U.N.T.S. 567 (200+ parties as of 2023)
errors.violation_detail: Parenthetical context useful for reader understanding of treaty's scope

errors.description: Omitting information about U.S. ratification status when relevant to citation credibility
errors.example_correct: Protocol on XYZ, Dec. 10, 1997, 1350 U.N.T.S. 400 (not ratified by U.S.)
errors.violation_detail: For U.S. audiences, note whether U.S. is party to treaty

errors.description: Using improper format for International Court of Justice cases
errors.example_correct: Case Name (Party v. Party), Judgment, 1999 I.C.J. 100 (date)
errors.violation_detail: ICJ citations require case type (Judgment, Advisory Opinion, Order) per Bluebook 21.5.1

errors.error_type: Missing Decision Type in International Case
errors.description: Omitting case type (Judgment, Order, Advisory Opinion, etc.) for international tribunals
errors.example_correct: Case Name (Party v. Party), Judgment, 1999 I.C.J. 100 (Aug. 15, 1999)
errors.violation_detail: Decision type clarifies nature and binding effect of tribunal output

errors.description: Using improper format for European Court of Justice case numbers (C- vs. T- vs. newer format)
errors.example_correct: Case C-123/04, Case Name, 2005 E.C.R. I-1234 (date)
errors.violation_detail: ECJ cases require case letter prefix (C for Court of Justice, T for General Court) per Bluebook 21.5.2

errors.description: Citing only E.C.R. for ECJ cases decided after 2012 when E.C.R. no longer official reporter
errors.violation_detail: E.C.R. only available through 2012; cite to EUR-Lex or other official source after

errors.description: Using incorrect citation format for European Court of Human Rights decisions
errors.example_correct: Smith v. United Kingdom, App. No. 12345/06, 2010 Eur. Ct. H.R. (Judgment of July 2, 2010)
errors.violation_detail: ECtHR requires application number and judgment date per Bluebook 21.5.3

errors.description: Omitting application number from ECtHR citation
errors.example_incorrect: Smith v. United Kingdom, 2010 Eur. Ct. H.R.
errors.example_correct: Smith v. United Kingdom, App. No. 12345/06, 2010 Eur. Ct. H.R.
errors.violation_detail: Application number essential for locating ECtHR decisions

errors.description: Using improper format for Inter-American Commission on Human Rights citations
errors.example_incorrect: Smith v. Country, Case No. 2014-1234, IACHR
errors.example_correct: Smith v. Country, Case No. 2014-1234, Inter-Am. C.H.R., OEA/Ser.L/V/II.122 Doc. 5 rev.1 (2004)
errors.violation_detail: IACHR requires OAS document numbering per Bluebook 21.5.4

errors.description: Confusing Series A and Series C designations for Inter-American Court of Human Rights
errors.example_incorrect: Smith v. Argentina, Inter-Am. Ct. H.R. (ser. A) No. 150
errors.example_correct: Smith v. Argentina, Merits, Judgment, Inter-Am. Ct. H.R. (ser. C) No. 150 (2001)
errors.violation_detail: Series C for judgments, Series A for advisory opinions per Bluebook 21.5.5

errors.description: Omitting indication of stage (Merits, Reparations, Provisional Measures, etc.) for international cases
errors.example_incorrect: Smith v. Argentina, Inter-Am. Ct. H.R. (ser. C) No. 150 (2001)
errors.example_correct: Smith v. Argentina, Merits, Judgment, Inter-Am. Ct. H.R. (ser. C) No. 150 (2001)
errors.violation_detail: Judgment stage clarifies what decision is being cited

errors.description: Using improper format for International Tribunal for the Law of the Sea cases
errors.example_correct: The M/V Saiga (No. 2) (St. Vincent v. Guinea), Case No. 2, Order of Jan. 20, 1998, ITLOS Rep. 123
errors.violation_detail: ITLOS requires case number, parties, and reporter citation per Bluebook 21.5.6

errors.description: Using non-standard format for International Criminal Court case numbers
errors.example_correct: Prosecutor v. Lubanga, Case No. ICC-01/04-01/06, Judgment (Mar. 14, 2012)
errors.violation_detail: ICC case numbers should be formatted consistently with institutional style

errors.description: Failing to clearly identify which tribunal (ICTY or ICTR) decided case
errors.example_incorrect: Prosecutor v. Tadić, Case No. IT-94-1-A, Appeals Judgment (July 15, 1999)
errors.example_correct: Prosecutor v. Tadić, Case No. IT-94-1-A, Appeals Judgment (Int'l Crim. Trib. for Former Yugoslavia July 15, 1999)
errors.violation_detail: Must identify ICTY vs. ICTR for clarity per Bluebook 21.5.7

errors.description: Using improper format for World Trade Organization dispute settlement reports
errors.example_incorrect: US v. EU, Appellate Body Report, DS2/AB/R
errors.example_correct: Appellate Body Report, United States – Measures Affecting XYZ, WTO Doc. WT/DS2/AB/R (adopted May 20, 1996)
errors.violation_detail: WTO requires formal document title, number format, and adoption date

errors.description: Omitting adoption date for WTO panel or Appellate Body reports
errors.example_incorrect: Panel Report, United States – Standard for Reformulated Gasoline, WTO Doc. WT/DS2/R
errors.example_correct: Panel Report, United States – Standard for Reformulated Gasoline, WTO Doc. WT/DS2/R (adopted May 20, 1996)
errors.violation_detail: Adoption date essential for establishing when WTO decision became final

errors.error_type: National Court International Law Case Citation Error
errors.description: Citing national court decision on international law issue in improper format per rule 21.5.9
errors.example_incorrect: International Law Case, Case Name, International Law Reports 2010 123
errors.example_correct: Case Name, [year] Case reporter, page (court country)
errors.violation_detail: National court cases should be cited as national cases, not international cases per Bluebook 21.5.9

errors.description: Failing to include proper U.N. document symbol (A/-, S/-, etc.) in citation
errors.example_incorrect: U.N. General Assembly Meeting Record, Oct. 10, 2000
errors.example_correct: U.N. GAOR, 55th Sess., 40th plen. mtg., U.N. Doc. A/55/PV.40 (Oct. 10, 2000)
errors.violation_detail: U.N. document symbol essential for accurate identification and location

errors.description: Using improper format for U.N. document symbols (should be A/-, S/-, ST/-, etc.)
errors.violation_detail: Document symbol format must follow U.N. convention per Bluebook 21.7

errors.description: Omitting session number and type when required for U.N. meeting records
errors.example_correct: U.N. GAOR, 55th Sess., 40th plen. mtg., U.N. Doc. A/55/PV.40 (Oct. 10, 2000)
errors.violation_detail: Session information helps locate specific meeting record per Bluebook 21.7.1

errors.description: Confusing verbatim records (PV) and summary records (SR) designations
errors.example_incorrect: U.N. GAOR Summary Record, U.N. Doc. A/55/PV.40
errors.violation_detail: PV for verbatim, SR for summary per Bluebook 21.7.1

errors.description: Omitting resolution number from U.N. resolution citations
errors.example_incorrect: U.N. SCOR, 57th Sess., U.N. Doc. S/RES/(2002)
errors.example_correct: U.N. Security Council Resolution 1441, U.N. SCOR, 57th Sess., U.N. Doc. S/RES/1441 (2002)
errors.violation_detail: Resolution number essential for identifying specific U.N. resolution

errors.description: Using non-standard abbreviations for U.N. resolutions (G.A. Res., S.C. Res., etc.)
errors.example_incorrect: General Assembly Resolution 2108, U.N. Doc. A/RES/2108
errors.violation_detail: Use standard abbreviations per Bluebook 21.7.2

errors.description: Omitting author or originating body for U.N. reports when author identified
errors.example_incorrect: Report on the Work of the Organization, U.N. Doc. A/74/1 (2019)
errors.example_correct: Secretary-General, Report on the Work of the Organization, U.N. Doc. A/74/1 (2019)
errors.violation_detail: Author attribution clarifies source credibility and context per Bluebook 21.7.3

errors.description: Using improper format for U.N. committee reports (e.g., Human Rights Committee)
errors.example_incorrect: Human Rights Committee Report: Canada, U.N. Doc. CCPR/C/CAN/CO/6
errors.example_correct: Human Rights Comm., Concluding Observations: Canada, U.N. Doc. CCPR/C/CAN/CO/6 (2015)
errors.violation_detail: Follow specific format for committee reports per Bluebook 21.7.3

errors.description: Omitting press release number from U.N. press release citations
errors.example_incorrect: U.N. Department of Public Information Press Release (Jan. 1, 2020)
errors.example_correct: U.N. Dep't of Pub. Info., Press Release No. SG/SM/2021 (Jan. 1, 2020)
errors.violation_detail: Press release number aids in locating exact statement per Bluebook 21.7.5

errors.description: Using inconsistent abbreviations for same U.N. body (GAOR vs. GA, SCOR vs. SC)
errors.example_incorrect: First: U.N. GAOR; Later: GA, 55th Sess.
errors.violation_detail: Maintain consistent abbreviations for U.N. bodies throughout document

errors.description: Omitting paragraph number when citing specific paragraph of U.N. document
errors.example_incorrect: Secretary-General, Report on the Work of the Organization, U.N. Doc. A/74/1 (2019)
errors.example_correct: Secretary-General, Report on the Work of the Organization, U.N. Doc. A/74/1, ¶ 5 (2019)
errors.violation_detail: Paragraph pinpoint enables precise location of cited material

errors.description: Using improper format for U.N. Yearbook citations
errors.violation_detail: Use standard abbreviation U.N. Y.B. per Bluebook 21.7.8

errors.description: Incorrectly formatting U.N. Charter citations (should be simple form without date)
errors.example_incorrect: Charter of the United Nations art. 55, June 26, 1945, 59 Stat. 1031
errors.violation_detail: U.N. Charter citations need only designation and article per Bluebook 21.7.10

errors.description: Improperly citing U.N. web-based materials, missing required elements per rule 18 and 21.7.11
errors.example_incorrect: U.N. website article on XYZ, un.org
errors.example_correct: U.N., Title of Article, http://... (last visited Nov. 23, 2025)
errors.violation_detail: Web citations require author/agency, title, URL, and access date per rule 18

errors.error_type: Missing League of Nations Treaty Series Citation
errors.description: Citing League of Nations treaty without proper L.N.T.S. reference format
errors.example_incorrect: Convention on XYZ, July 5, 1921, League Doc. 50
errors.violation_detail: League of Nations treaties cited to L.N.T.S. per Bluebook 21.8

errors.description: Using improper format for EU regulations and directives per rule 21.9
errors.violation_detail: EU legislation requires number/year, Official Journal with volume, and page

errors.description: Omitting Official Journal citation for EU legislation when required
errors.violation_detail: Official Journal citation essential for EU material per Bluebook 21.9

errors.description: Using improper format for EU Commission documents (COM, SEC, etc.)
errors.violation_detail: EU documents require standard notation (COM, SEC, etc.) and session notation per rule 21.9

errors.error_type: Missing Council of Europe Treaty Series
errors.description: Failing to cite Council of Europe treaties to E.T.S. or C.E.T.S.
errors.example_incorrect: European Convention on Human Rights, Nov. 4, 1950
errors.example_correct: European Convention on Human Rights, Nov. 4, 1950, Europ. T.S. No. 5
errors.violation_detail: Council of Europe treaties cited to E.T.S. or C.E.T.S. per Bluebook 21.10

errors.description: Using incorrect abbreviation or format for European Treaty Series citations
errors.violation_detail: Use standard abbreviation 'Europ. T.S.' per Bluebook 21.10

errors.description: Misformatting the foundational WTO agreement citation
errors.example_correct: Marrakesh Agreement Establishing the World Trade Organization art. IX, Apr. 15, 1994, 1867 U.N.T.S. 154
errors.violation_detail: Marrakesh Agreement is formal name; include specific article citation when applicable

errors.error_type: Incorrect WTO Panel Dispute Number Format
errors.description: Using improper format for WTO dispute settlement case numbers (DS notation)
errors.example_incorrect: Panel Report, United States – XYZ, WTO WT2/AB/R
errors.example_correct: Panel Report, United States – XYZ, WTO Doc. WT/DS2/R
errors.violation_detail: WTO document format requires 'WT/DS' notation per Bluebook 21.11

errors.description: Omitting document number or country report number for IMF citations
errors.violation_detail: IMF materials require document/report numbers for precise identification

errors.description: Using improper format for OECD document citations
errors.example_correct: OECD, Title of Report, OECD Doc. No. (2020)
errors.violation_detail: OECD publications should include document number and standard format

errors.description: Using inconsistent formats for OAS document symbols (OEA/Ser vs. OAS Doc)
errors.example_incorrect: First: OAS Doc. X; Later: OEA/Ser. X
errors.violation_detail: Use standard OAS notation format consistently

errors.description: Omitting necessary publication information for non-governmental organization reports
errors.violation_detail: NGO publications need organization name, title, page, and year

errors.description: Using improper citation format for African Union or other regional org materials
errors.example_correct: AU, Assembly Decision No. 123 (2020) or appropriate AU Doc. format
errors.violation_detail: Follow institutional document format conventions for regional organizations

errors.error_type: Incorrect International Law Commission Yearbook Citation
errors.description: Using improper format for ILC Yearbook citations
errors.example_incorrect: 2018 International Law Commission Yearbook vol. II at 10
errors.example_correct: 2018 Y.B. Int'l L. Comm'n vol. II, pt. 2, at 10, U.N. Doc. A/CN.4/SER.A/2018/Add.1
errors.violation_detail: ILC Yearbooks require specific format with volume, part, and U.N. document number

errors.description: Omitting U.N. document number when citing ILC Yearbook
errors.example_incorrect: 2018 Y.B. Int'l L. Comm'n vol. II at 10
errors.example_correct: 2018 Y.B. Int'l L. Comm'n vol. II, pt. 2, at 10, U.N. Doc. A/CN.4/SER.A/2018/Add.1
errors.violation_detail: U.N. document number facilitates locating yearbook material

errors.error_type: Incorrect Digest of International Law Cases Citation
errors.description: Using improper format for digests of international legal materials
errors.example_correct: Digest of International Cases, No. 15, at 45 (Int'l Ct. 2010)
errors.violation_detail: Digest citations require number, page, issuing body, and year per Bluebook 21.16

errors.description: Omitting volume number or part for multi-volume digest citations
errors.example_incorrect: Digest of United States Practice in International Law 123
errors.example_correct: 8 Digest of United States Practice in International Law 123 (1977)
errors.violation_detail: Volume number essential for multi-volume digest citations

errors.description: Using improper supra form for treaties, omitting essential elements in short citation
errors.example_correct: Charter of the United Nations, supra note 1, art. 55
errors.violation_detail: Short citations to treaties must include formal name and article/section per Bluebook 21.17

errors.error_type: id. Used Incorrectly for International Materials
errors.description: Using id. when preceding citation is not to same international source or context differs
errors.example_incorrect: International case, page 100. Other material. Id. at 200.
errors.example_correct: International case, page 100. International case, page 200.
errors.violation_detail: id. only permissible for immediately preceding citation to exact same source

errors.error_type: Missing Hereinafter Abbreviation for Long Treaty Names
errors.description: Failing to establish hereinafter abbreviation for unwieldy treaty or document names
errors.example_incorrect: Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora..., later citing full name repeatedly
errors.example_correct: Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora [hereinafter CITES], later citing "CITES, supra note X"
errors.violation_detail: Hereinafter abbreviations aid readability for lengthy international document names

errors.description: Omitting required parenthetical explanation when foreign/international material may not be familiar to readers
errors.example_correct: Conseil d'État June 27, 2014, Rec. Lebon 312 (Fr.) (describing proposed legislation on immigration)
errors.violation_detail: Parenthetical explanation contextualizes unfamiliar foreign/international materials

errors.description: Using different methods for pinpoint citations across foreign and international materials (e.g., p. vs. page, ¶ vs. para.)
errors.example_correct: Case 1 at 45; Case 2 at para. 50; Case 3 at ¶ 55
errors.violation_detail: Use consistent pinpoint notation throughout document

errors.error_type: Mixing Citation Formats from Different Jurisdictions
errors.description: Using inconsistent formats when citing similar materials from different jurisdictions
errors.example_incorrect: German case: BVerfG Mar. 3, 2004, 111 BVerfGE 307; French case: Cass. civ., June 15, 2010, Bull. civ.
errors.example_correct: Maintain parallel structure across similar materials from different jurisdictions
errors.violation_detail: Parallel structure improves consistency and readability

errors.description: Omitting date of decision, enactment, or publication for foreign/international materials
errors.example_correct: Code civil art. 1234 (Fr. 1804) or year of amendment
errors.violation_detail: Dates necessary for identifying versions and establishing temporal scope

errors.description: Providing vague or insufficient parenthetical context for how foreign/international material supports proposition
errors.example_correct: Code civil art. 1234 (Fr.) (establishing liability without fault under French law).
errors.violation_detail: Parenthetical must explain relevance to reader's understanding

errors.description: Failing to consult and follow Table T2 country-specific citation formats
errors.example_correct: Consult Table T2 for country-specific requirements for all foreign materials
errors.violation_detail: Table T2 provides authoritative country-specific abbreviations and formats

errors.description: Citing foreign/international material from secondary or non-official source when official source available
errors.example_incorrect: Statute cited from law firm website summary
errors.example_correct: Statute cited from official government gazette or compilation
errors.violation_detail: Use official sources per Bluebook preference for reliability

errors.description: Using signal (See, See also, Cf., etc.) without considering whether citation actually supports proposition
errors.example_incorrect: See German Civil Code art. 100 (Fr.) [when actually comparing positions]
errors.example_correct: Cf. German Civil Code art. 100 (Fr.) [for comparative authority]
errors.violation_detail: Signal must accurately represent relationship between cited authority and proposition per rule 1.2

analysis_notes.coverage: Comprehensive analysis of Bluebook Rules 20 (Foreign Materials) and 21 (International Materials) with 55 subrules analyzed
analysis_notes.methodology: Error types derived from detailed examination of each subrule with emphasis on citation format, jurisdiction identification, language handling, and source documentation
analysis_notes.practical_application: Error types categorized by frequency and severity for priority remediation in legal citation review processes
analysis_notes.bluebook_version: Bluebook (21st edition assumed based on rules 20-21 structure)
analysis_notes.recommendation: Implement SLR citation checker with validation rules for each error type, prioritizing Critical and Major errors with High frequency
